instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only power when <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> gets some heat
threads.message:
Clean board has come in 2 times, <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> was replaced and worked for about 2 weeks, back again and no power, but when I apply some heat to <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> board turns on, I know that looks like <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> may be the problem, but I dont want to replace that, have the board work again for 1-2 weeks and get it back in here again, any advice is greatly appreciated. 

When board doesnt power on pp3v42 is 3.8v, there is no green light and of course no power.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only power when <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> gets some heat
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only power when <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> gets some heat
threads.message:
Just to check I measured all those 3 components
<CAPACITOR>C7095</CAPACITOR> is 0.256uf Not sure...
<RESISTOR>R7095</RESISTOR> is 348k OK
<RESISTOR>R7096</RESISTOR> is 200k OK

I will test after board cools off and report back

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only power when <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> gets some heat
threads.message: Change <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>, if its feedback pin is not steady 1.25V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only power when <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> gets some heat
threads.message:
I have another one of this boards in here again, different one this time but same problem <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is 2.5v if I apply heat around <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> that line goes to 3.42v and board works fine until its shut down for a while.

So far I have replaced <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> L7095 <CAPACITOR>C7094</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C7095</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R7095</RESISTOR>

<CHIP>U7090</CHIP>
1 1.27v steady
2 2.5v
3 5.4v
4 2.5v
5 Gnd
6 16.49v
7 0v
8 16.49v

Last time I got a board in for warranty with this same issues I replaced ALL components around <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> and it did not come back again, but I want to find out what it could be so I only replace that part and not everything again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only power when <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> gets some heat
threads.message: The biggest problem here is that sometimes it will start up fine even when is cold and work fine for days, but eventually it fails and it comes back for warranty.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only power when <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> gets some heat
threads.message:
Usually Ra/Rb resistors affected by corrosion.
Sometime leakage on the cap in paralel with Ra; because of corrosion too.
Could be even internal problem of the chip, which doesn't control feedback correctly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only power when <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> gets some heat
threads.message: Thanks, on this one I did the same thing, replaced all components around <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> and all is fine, next time I get another one in I will check more, so far I have seen about 3 of the same exact problem.
